alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Knox; Peoria; Schuyler; Stark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 2:23PM CST until January 20 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM FRIDAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Knox, Stark, Peoria, Fulton and Schuyler Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 AM Friday to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The bulk of the snow accumulations are expected this evening, with snow rates of over a half inch per hour.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you have to spend any time outside, wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com
